titleStmt.title: C. L. McCoun et al., Bond
CWG6400

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Stephen Clark being in custody charged with the offense of larceny, and being admitted to bail in the sum of Three hundred dollars, now, We, C. L. McCoun, T. E. Fulkerson, J. V. Fentress & W. H Herman of Muhlenberg County Kentucky, hereby undertake that we the above named Stephen Clark will appear in the Muhlenberg Circuit Court on the first day of its next November term to answer said charge and will at all times render himself amenable to the orders and process of said Court in the prosecution of said charge, and if convicted, will render himself in execution thereof, or, if, he shall fail to perform either of these conditions, that we will pay to the Commonwealth of Kentucky the sum of three hundred dollars. Witness our hands this 27th day of September 1864.

C. L. McCoun
T. E. Fulkerson,
J. V. Fentress,
W. H. Herman,
Taken and subscribed before me as Presiding Judge of the Muhlenberg County Court, this 27th September 1864,
B. J. Shaver P. J. M. C. C.

Muhlenberg Circuit Court
Nov term Nov. 16th 1864.

Commonwealth of Kentucky Plff
against} On Bail Bond
Stephen Clark &c Defts

On motion of the atty for the Commlth, the defendant Clark having been called and failing to appear in the discharge of his bail bond entered into on the 27th day of September 1864 in the sum of three hundred dollars, It is therefore adjudged by the court that said bail bond be and is hereby declared forfeited, and
that a summons is awarded against C. L. McCoun, T. E. Fulkerson, J. V. Fentress and W. H. Herman, returnable to the first day of the next term of this Court, to show cause if any they can why Judgment shall not be rendered against them for three hundred dollars as the sureties of said Stephen Clark on said forfeited bail bond, for the appearance of the said Stephen Clark in this court on the first day of its present term and further to do &c --
upon which summons issued & was returned by the sheriff of Muhlenberg County duly executed on the said C. L. McCoun, T. E. Fulkerson, J. V. Fentress, and W. H. Herman on the 18th of April 1865,

Muhlenberg Circuit Court
May term, May 9, 1865,

The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plff
against } On forfeited Bail Bond.
C. L. McCoun, T. E. Fulkerson, J. V. Fentress, & W. H. Herman Defts

The defendants C. L. McCoun, T. E. Fulkerson, J. V. Fentress, & W. H. Herman having been duly summoned and failing to answer, It is adjudged by the court that the Commonwealth of Kentucky recover of the defendants C. L. McCoun, T. E. Fulkerson, J. V. Fentress & W. H. Herman the sum of three hundred dollars with interest thereon at the rate of 6 per cent from this date, and the costs of this prosecution and that execution may issue thereon --

State of Kentucky
Muhlenberg Circuit } Sct,

I T. J. Jones deputy for J. H Reno clerk of said court do certify that the foregoing is a true copy of the bail bond
executed by C. L. McCoun & others in the case of the Comlth vs Stephen Clark, and of the order forfeiting said bond and the judgment thereon --
given under my hand, this 26th day of May 1865.

Tho. J. Jones D. C.
for J. H Reno Clk
